alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Southern Mountains; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 01 at 2:13PM MST until December 02 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with amounts decreasing sharply towards shadowed areas at lower elevations. * WHERE...Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs, Central Mountains and Southern Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions will impact the Friday morning commute. Strong winds with the front are likely to also cause areas of blowing and drifting of snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong cold front will bring a band of moderate to heavy snow between 5 am and 10 am depending on location, lasting 1-2 hours in most areas. This will bring significant travel impacts for many areas, including higher summits of I-15 and I-70. Uncertainty remains as to how long the moderate to heavy snow lingers behind the front, which could result in a more prolonged period of impacts.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
